page.title: 14A Vicar's Life:Chatteris
page.content: The vicar of St Peter and St Paul has been looking after the church for 11 years and in that time the congregation has risen steadily. It is a busy and varied life. He is rural dean and has to look after other local churches if needed. At present this means a lot of extra work as several vicars are missing through illness or moving to other jobs. There are also the general parish duties - preparing and giving sermons, taking services, performing christen- ings, marriages(about 30 a year) and funerals and visiting parishioners. The main service on Sunday is attended by over 100 people. Funerals take precedence over other activities. There are groups for Bible studies, young people and mothers. The most enjoyable aspect of the job is meeting other people in the community.
